name: Acid (vial)
description: As an action, you can splash the contents of this vial onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the vial up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the acid as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 acid damage.

effects.name: Acid Splash
effects.description: Ranged improvised attack, 2d6 acid damage on hit.

name: Alchemist's fire (flask)
description: As an action, you can throw this flask up to 20 feet. On a hit, the target takes 1d4 fire damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can end this damage by using its action to make a DC 10 Dexterity check.

effects.name: Alchemist's Fire Effect
effects.description: Ranged improvised attack, target takes 1d4 fire damage at the start of each turn. DC 10 Dex check to end.

name: Antitoxin (vial)
description: A creature that drinks this vial of liquid gains advantage on saving throws against poison for 1 hour.

name: Ball bearings (bag of 1,000)
description: As an action, you can spill these to cover a 10-foot square. A creature moving across must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone.

name: Caltrops (bag of 20)
description: As an action, you can spread these in a 5-foot square. A creature entering the area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or stop moving and take 1 piercing damage.

name: Holy water (flask)
description: As an action, you can throw this flask up to 20 feet. If the target is a fiend or undead, it takes 2d6 radiant damage.

effects.name: Holy Water Splash
effects.description: Ranged improvised attack, 2d6 radiant damage to fiends/undead.

name: Potion of Healing
description: A character who drinks the magical red fluid in this vial regains 2d4 + 2 hit points. Drinking or administering a potion takes an action.

name: Arrows (20)
description: Ammunition for bows.

name: Crossbow bolts (20)
description: Ammunition for crossbows.

description: A holy symbol for a cleric or paladin.

name: Emblem (holy symbol)
description: A holy symbol for a cleric or paladin, often on a shield.

name: Reliquary (holy symbol)

name: Backpack
description: A backpack can hold 1 cubic foot/30 pounds of gear.

name: Bedroll
description: A bedroll for sleeping.

name: Book
description: A book might contain poetry, historical accounts, or lore.

name: Candle
description: For 1 hour, a candle sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet.

name: Chain (10 feet)
description: A chain has 10 hit points. It can be burst with a successful DC 20 Strength check.

name: Climber’s Kit
description: Includes pitons, boot tips, gloves, and a harness. Allows you to anchor yourself.

name: Component Pouch
description: A small, watertight leather belt pouch that has compartments to hold all the material components for your spells.

name: Crowbar
description: Using a crowbar grants advantage to Strength checks where the crowbar’s leverage can be applied.

name: Healer’s Kit
description: This kit has ten uses. As an action, you can expend one use of the kit to stabilize a creature that has 0 hit points, without needing to make a Wisdom (Medicine) check.

name: Lamp
description: A lamp casts bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. It burns for 6 hours on one flask of oil.

name: Lantern, Hooded
description: Casts bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. You can lower the hood to reduce the light.

name: Oil (flask)
description: As an action, you can throw this flask up to 20 feet. On a hit, the target is covered in oil. If the target takes any fire damage before the oil dries (after 1 minute), it takes an additional 5 fire damage.

name: Rations (1 day)
description: Rations consist of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

name: Rope, hempen (50 feet)
description: Rope has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

name: Rope, silk (50 feet)
description: Rope has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

name: Tinderbox
description: This small container holds flint, fire steel, and tinder. Using it to light a torch takes an action.

name: Torch
description: A torch burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

name: Waterskin
description: A leather container for holding water. Weighs 5 lbs when full.

name: String (10 feet)
description: A 10-foot length of string.

description: A small bell.

name: Hammer
description: A standard hammer.

name: Piton
description: A metal spike used for climbing.

name: Chest
description: A chest can hold 12 cubic feet/300 pounds of gear.
